newsitem.title: USA: Larson-Davis and Procter & Gamble in pact.
newsitem.headline: Larson-Davis and Procter & Gamble in pact.

text.p: Larson-Davis Inc said Wednesday it agreed to develop with Procter & Gamble Co a commercial supercritical fluid chromatography (SFC) instrument which will be used for chemical analysis in product development and quality control.
Procter & Gamble is one of the largest industrial SFC users.

New products developed from the two year agreement are expected to be five to ten times faster than existing solutions. In addition they will be lower in cost, provide improved measurement versatility, be smaller in size, and offer greater reliability, Larson-Davis said in a statement.
Initial products from this agreement are scheduled for market introduction in less than one year.
Larson-Davis develops, makes and markets ultra-sensitive analytical instrumentation for the chemical, gas, acoustics and vibration market.
